content: spring ecstasy pattern and photos tiina kuu tech editing helena kahan the spring ecstasy socks are worked toe up with a delicate mirrored twisted-stitch cable pattern running up the front sides of the left and right sock the heel flap is worked in the sole and the heel turn is followed by heel back decreases that are surrounded by twisted stitch cables this is a slightly modified and significantly extended version of the original pattern first published in 2014 the pattern was originally named keväthuuma in finnish size yarn and yardage there are instructions for sizes extra-small 54 mokku yarn 75% merino 25% nylon 425 m / sts small 60 sts medium 66 sts and large 100 g 70-100 grams of light green kirva 72 sts which are referred to in the colourway instructions as xs s m l if only one stitch any other fingering weight can be used count is given it applies to all sizes sizes xs s m l fit foot circumference of approximately 17 19 21 23 cm / 6 ¾ 7½ gauge 8¼ 9 inches with some negative ease 34 sts and 44 row = 10 cm / 4 inches in stockinette before you start please read the instructions carefully the needles instep and front of the leg are worked on needle 1 the sole heel flap heel turn gusset size 2 0 mm / us0 or suitable to obtain decreases and back of the leg are worked on gauge circular needles at least 80 cm / 32 needle 2 inches long please note that there are mirrored charts for dpns two shorter circulars or a mini circular the right and left sock also note that sts are can be used but the instructions have been redistributed a few times making it a bit written for magic loop tricky to work two-at-a-time in magic loop any short row technique can be used for the heel turn other supplies stitch markers tapestry needle cable needle optional sock blockers optional spring ecstasy socks page 1/7 instructions the heel flap and heel turn are worked back and forth across the 23 23 25 27 sts on needle 2 as follows toe row 1 rs k23 k23 k25 k27 turn
